required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Social Proximity on Conversion to Generic Prescription Medications
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Social Proximity on Conversion to Generic Prescription Medications

lead_sponsor.agency: National Bureau of Economic Research, Inc.

clinical_study.source: National Bureau of Economic Research, Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this project is to understand the effects of receiving peer information on individuals' conversion rates from brand name prescription medication to generic prescription medication.

detailed_description.textblock:
At companies where employees are predominantly union members, we will compare the efficacy of a peer information intervention using a testimonial from a union identified employee to an intervention using a testimonial with no union identification, as well as to a no-testimonial intervention.
The control arm will receive a letter signed by our partner company's Chief Medical Officer, explaining the health and monetary benefits of switching from brand name prescription medication to generic prescription medication. The testimonial treatment arm will receive the exact same letter, but the letter will feature an employee's testimonial along with the first name, last initial, city and state of the employee giving the testimonial. The testimonial and union arm will receive the same letter as the testimonial treatment arm but with the addition of the union affiliation of the employee giving the testimonial.

primary_outcome.measure: Conversion from Brand Name to Generic Prescription Medication
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month to one year after the intervention.
primary_outcome.description: We will measure conversion rates of employees from brand name to generic prescription medication by treatment arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Union Status and Conversation to Generic Medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One month to one year after the intervention.
secondary_outcome.description: We will see how union affiliation affects the employee conversion rates from brand name to prescription medication by treatment arm.

clinical_study.condition: Conversion From Brand Name to Generic Medication

arm_group.description: The testimonial and union arm will receive the same letter as the testimonial treatment arm but with the addition of the union affiliation of the employee giving the testimonial.

The control arm will receive a letter signed by our partner company's Chief Medical Officer, explaining the health and monetary benefits of switching from brand name prescription medication to generic prescription medication.

The testimonial treatment arm will receive the exact same letter as the control arm, but the letter will feature an employee's testimonial along with the first name, last initial, city and state of the employee giving the testimonial.

intervention.intervention_name: Social Proximity and Conversion to Generic Medications
intervention.description: At companies where employees are predominantly union members, we will compare the efficacy of a peer information intervention using a testimonial from a union identified employee to an intervention using a testimonial with no union identification, as well as to a no-testimonial intervention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Employee of a company that uses Express Scripts as its pharmacy benefits manager.
- Employee at a company with predominantly union employees.
- Currently taking a brand name medication with an exact generic equivalent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Employees on any psychological prescription medication.
